body.p: To His Excellency Governor Thomas E. Bramlette

Mr. Charles Meyer who has just been discharged from the Penitentiary is a citizen of Louisville and was convicted for obtaining money under false pretences at a term of our Court, during which I acted as prosecuting attorney pro tem. He desired to regain his rights and qualifications lost by reason of his conviction. If your Excellency can restore him to these enjoyments, I earnestly recommend to your favor

Your obdt Svt
Martin Bijur
Debr 20/65

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Chas Meyer
Pardoned 20th Dec/65

To His Excellency Governor
Thomas E. Blamlette
